title: Renew or replace your adult passport

details.description: Renew or replace your adult UK passport - application form, how long it takes, track your application, unexpired visas
details.body:
You can renew or replace your UK adult passport up to 9 months before your current one runs out. It costs £72.50 by post or £81.25 through the Post Office’s Passport Check & Send service.

How long it takes

It takes at least 3 weeks to get your passport - use a different service if you need your passport urgently. Don’t book travel until you have a valid passport.

Applications can take longer between April and September - apply early if you can.

Time left on your existing passport is added to your new one - up to a maximum of 9 months.

Damaged passports

If your passport has more than reasonable wear and tear, replace it as soon as you can - you may not be allowed to travel with it.

Application form

If you’re in the UK, you can:

  • fill in the form online - the Identity and Passport Service (IPS) will post it back to you to check and sign
  • get one from a Post Office that offers the Passport Check & Send service
  • ask the Passport Adviceline to post you one

If you’re outside the UK, you apply in a different way.

Passport Adviceline

Email enquiry form
Telephone 0300 222 0000
Textphone 0300 222 0222
Text Relay 18001 0300 222 0000
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, Sunday and public holidays, 9am to 5:30pm

Download ‘Guidance notes - Applying for a passport’ (PDF, 495KB)

Photos

Include 2 identical new photos of yourself. Your application can be delayed if you don’t follow the rules about passport photos.

Countersignatories

Get your application form and 1 of your photos signed by someone else to prove your identity if either:

  • you can’t be recognised from the photo in your existing passport
  • you’re replacing a damaged passport

Unexpired visas

If you’re renewing your passport, send your previous passport with the visa attached to it with your application. Your previous passport will be returned with your new one.

Carry both passports if you want to use the visa in the previous passport.

Send your application

You can either:

  • use the Passport Check & Send service
  • post your application - use the pre-addressed envelope that comes with the form and include your existing passport, photos and supporting documents

If you apply by post, you can either:

  • pay by debit or credit card - fill in the form in the application pack
  • send a cheque payable to ‘Identity and Passport Service’

Receiving your new passport

Your new passport will be sent to your home address securely - either by courier or Royal Mail Recorded Delivery. If no-one is at home, you’ll either be left a card or posted a letter explaining what happens next. The card or letter won’t mention that the package contains your passport.

Track your passport application

To check your application’s progress, contact the Passport Adviceline - you can do this 3 weeks after you apply.

You need either:

  • the barcode number from your application form
  • the number on your receipt if you used Passport Check & Send or applied at a Passport Customer Service Centre

Passport Adviceline

Email enquiry form
Telephone: 0300 222 0000
Textphone: 0300 222 0222
Text Relay: 18001 0300 222 0000
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Saturday, Sunday and public holidays, 9am to 5:30pm
